edge: Director John McTiernan didn't like the first draft of the script because it focused more on social commentary, while he thought that the audience would prefer to see more of the Rollerball scenes.
The movie's first cut, which was over two hours long, was test screened in Las Vegas around April or May 2001, and got a very negative response from test audiences.
MGM pushed the release date from May to July 13, 2001 to test the movie again, hoping that they would find the right audience for it.
The name of the main character in the film was changed from Jonathan E. To Jonathan Cross.
